name: Lofexidine (Lucemyra)
summary: An alpha-2 adrenergic agonist used to manage symptoms of opioid withdrawal.
description: Lofexidine is a centrally acting alpha-2 adrenergic receptor agonist approved for mitigation of withdrawal symptoms in patients discontinuing opioids. It works by reducing the release of norepinephrine, thereby alleviating autonomic symptoms such as sweating, chills, anxiety, and tachycardia. Unlike methadone or buprenorphine, lofexidine is not an opioid and does not reduce cravings, but it can be used as a non-opioid option for detoxification.

off_label_uses: Management of autonomic symptoms in other withdrawal syndromes
contraindications: Known hypersensitivity to lofexidine or excipients

items: Relief of opioid withdrawal symptoms in adults abruptly discontinuing opioids

sections.text: Stimulates alpha-2 adrenergic receptors in the brainstem, reducing sympathetic outflow and alleviating autonomic withdrawal symptoms.

adult.withdrawal: 0.54 mg (3 tablets) orally 4 times daily during peak withdrawal symptoms; maximum 2.88 mg/day for up to 14 days

sections.geriatric: Consider lower initial dose and monitor closely for hypotension
sections.renal_impairment: Avoid in severe impairment; use caution in moderate impairment

sections.text: Onset within hours; duration of effect about 6 hours.

other: Monitor for hypotension and bradycardia, especially during dose titration
Taper gradually to avoid rebound hypertension

items: Blood pressure and heart rate before and during treatment
ECG if risk factors for QT prolongation

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks; limited human data
sections.lactation: Unknown if excreted in human milk; use caution
sections.geriatrics: More susceptible to hypotension and bradycardia; use with caution
